Title: Document Search in .NET with Kernel Memory
Description: Ever wanted to search or perform question answering on documents, PDFs, or web pages but weren't sure about costs or security? Kernel Memory is a .NET library that allows you to use whatever embedding and text models you'd like (including Ollama and OpenAI models) and whatever vector store you'd like to index and search documents in a flexible way using a minimal amount of C# code.

Title: That fractal that's been up on my wall for 12 years
Description:
Warning: Math, Handwaving

I spent a lot of time doodling in middle school in lieu of whatever it is middle schoolers are
supposed to be doing. Somewhere between the Cool S’s
and Penrose triangles I stumbled upon a neat
way to fill up graph paper by repeatedly combining and copying squares. I suspected there was
more to the doodle but wasn’t quite sure how to analyze it. Deciding to delegate to a future version of me that
knows more math, I put it up on the wall behind my desk where it has followed me from high
school to college to the present day.
